result.execSummary:
The defendant Edwin Santiago-Caquias was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Attend Batterers Intervention program. Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate. Attend parenting classes.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.
No violent contact with victim, Helen O-G.

Defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharges, dna surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Costs to be paid while on probation to convert to a civil judgment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. To be used at the PO agent's discretion.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to CT 2 and to any other sentence

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( x ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  01/15/2015         Initials:  sm

Attorney Brian B. Burke in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defendant failed to appear. Court ordered a 20 day commitment upon arrest

Sentencing proceeded. State has satisfied victim notification. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
As to Count 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served. 
As to Count 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 2.
Both sentences are consecutive to any other sentence.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- attend Batterers Intervention program
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate
- attend parenting classes
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No violent contact with victim, Helen O-G
- obtain/maintain employment
- obtain GED/HSED
- no contact with firearms
- court ordered 35 days condition time, imposed and stayed to be used at the PO agent's discretion
- Defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharges, dna surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Cost to be paid while on probation to convert to a civil judgment.    Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 4 on 10-10-2014 at 1:30 pm
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights received and filed.
Defendant Edwin Santiago-Caquias in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.    Deputy court clerk:  vk
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Sworn as interpreter: Martha Hernandez.   mld
Victim, Helen O., appeared and requested modification of the no contact order.  Court denied modification at this time.   mld

Defendant Edwin Santiago-Caquias in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Martha Hernandez.
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNTS #2 and #3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-30-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

dated 6-20-2014, addressed to the court from Attorney Rick Steinberg, that the defendant is to start batterer's intervention therapy at La Luz Del Mundo.  Therapy would be for 24 weeks.  Defense counsel is requesting that the court calendar the 6-25-2014 hearing as a plea only, and then calendar a sentencing date in the future.  Defendant will then continue with his therapy.  Letter, received and filed.   mld

Violation Report from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
-- On 6-23-2014, defendant reported to Justice Point for a scheduled office contact.  During that time defendant was selected to provide a specimen for drug testing.  Defendant refused to provide a specimen and at that time decided to leave the JusticePoint office.  Defendant returned to Justice Point, at that time he was explained the drug esting protocol again and told that the Court had been notified.  Report, received and filed.  mld
Sworn as Spanish interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.   mld

Defendant Edwin Santiago-Caquias in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
Defense Motion to Modify the No Contact Order is heard and denied by the Court.  The Defendant would need to complete a substantial portion of treatment before any modifications are made to the no contact order, per the Court.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-25-2014 at 8:30 am.  Court ordered defendant to have absolute sobriety, no weapons, no violations of the law and continuation of the no contact order.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Edwin Santiago-Caquias in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Off the record.  Due to Branch 4 in trial and the need for a Spanish Interpreter, Bail / Bond Hearing and Pretrial Conference adjourned to 5-20-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld
Defendant's Motion for Bail Modification to Lift No Contact Order, received and filed.   mld
Sworn as interpreter:  Dawn Maldonado.

Defendant Edwin Santiago-Caquias in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 4.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter:  BRENDA BARTHOLOMEW.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with HELEN O-G. OR HER HOME RESIDENCE/SCHOOL/WORK/FAMILY.  ALSO NO CONTACT WITH LYDIA R., LIZBETH V-I.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Edwin Santiago-Caquias in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Edwin Santiago-Caquias in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 2 AND 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 04.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
